lead_paragraph: LEAD: In Presidential elections, California is regarded as a showdown state. But in Presidential primaries, Calfornia hardly shows up. The reason the most populous state has so little to say about who runs is simple: California's primary is held in June, after nearly all other states have voted and the race in both parties has largely been decided.

headline.main: A Louder Voice for the Largest State
